subject: Data
title: The First Known Data Chart
description: A quick, practical guide to The First Known Data Chart.

hook.text: In the 10th century, an anonymous scribe drew a graph of planetary movements. It had an X and Y axis.

buildup.text: This chart, found in a monastery manuscript, plotted planet positions over time â€” centuries before Descartes.

discovery.text: The idea of showing data as a picture rather than a table is over a thousand years old.

twist.text: Yet data visualization didn't become common until the 1700s. For centuries, tables dominated.

climax.text: That anonymous medieval chart proved a timeless truth: a picture shows what numbers can't tell.

punchline.text: Data visualization started a millennium ago.
